item.title: Sustainability and Health
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1368" align="alignright" width="300" caption="FreeCat on Flickr"][/caption]

With the recent trouble over the approval of GM alfalfa, we have been faced with the reality of a very un-sustainable agriculture in this country. Incidentally, the use of GM crops also threatens our health, but what about other circumstnaces where we must seemingly choose between health and sustainability? Does it make sense to adopt an eating pattern that promotes optimal health if it requires us to eat in a way that is detrimental to the planet and our society?

item.title: Time Magazine Explodes the Organic Myth, Kind Of
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_670" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Source: Digital Wallpapers on Flickr"][/caption]

Yesterday, the latest issue of Time Magazine arrived in the mail. And right on the cover was a blurb about an article on "The Organic Food Debate." I have some familiarity with the so called 'debate.' It basically boils down to this: organic/clean/sustainable/local food is great in theory, but it is too expensive/elitist/notÂ scalable. I have seen this sort of article several times, so I had a pretty good idea of the arguments to come, but I credit Time with a willingness to tackle tough issues and the integrity to present ambivalent conclusions. So I turned to the page and started reading.
